s.text: This would seem especially true in the current set of experiments, since the modulation of Thymidylate Synthase expression is known to greatly affect thymidine levels and cell growth [ 32 ] . For example, E. coli that are starved for thymine quickly die, a phenomenon known as 'thymineless death' [ 33 ] . In this respect, Group I aptazymes that may have yielded lower amounts of functional Thymidylate Synthase (e.g.
